org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.namenode

Class NamenodeFsck

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.namenode.NamenodeFsck
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataEncryptionKeyFactory

    @InterfaceAudience.Private
public class NamenodeFsck
extends Object
implements DataEncryptionKeyFactory
    This class provides rudimentary checking of DFS volumes for errors and sub-optimal conditions.

    The tool scans all files and directories, starting from an indicated root path. The following abnormal conditions are detected and handled:

    • files with blocks that are completely missing from all datanodes.
      In this case the tool can perform one of the following actions:
      • none (#FIXING_NONE)
      • move corrupted files to /lost+found directory on DFS (#FIXING_MOVE). Remaining data blocks are saved as a block chains, representing longest consecutive series of valid blocks.
      • delete corrupted files (#FIXING_DELETE)
    • detect files with under-replicated or over-replicated blocks
    Additionally, the tool collects a detailed overall DFS statistics, and optionally can print detailed statistics on block locations and replication factors of each file.

        private boolean doMove
        True if the user specified the -move option. Whe this option is in effect, we will copy salvaged blocks into the lost and found.

      • doDelete

        private boolean doDelete
        True if the user specified the -delete option. Whe this option is in effect, we will delete corrupted files.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NamenodeFsck

        NamenodeFsck(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration conf,
            NameNode namenode,
            org.apache.hadoop.net.NetworkTopology networktopology,
            Map<String,String[]> pmap,
            PrintWriter out,
            int totalDatanodes,
            short minReplication,
            InetAddress remoteAddress)
        Filesystem checker.
        Parameters:
        conf - configuration (namenode config)
        namenode - namenode that this fsck is going to use
        pmap - key=value[] map passed to the http servlet as url parameters
        out - output stream to write the fsck output
        totalDatanodes - number of live datanodes
        minReplication - minimum replication
        remoteAddress - source address of the fsck request
